smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class TextArtFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class Croller is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class PreviewBadge is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class Converters is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function setupRecyclerViews appears to be too complex.
The function setupDrawerAndToolbar appears to be too complex.
The function onDraw appears to be too complex.
The function onTouchEvent appears to be too complex.
The function onDraw appears to be too complex.
The function setValue appears to be too complex.
The function trim appears to be too complex.
The function convertBitmapToLEDHex appears to be too complex.
The function bind appears to be too complex.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'TextArtFragment' with '29' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'DrawerActivity' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'Croller' with '15' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'PreviewBadge' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'DrawBadgeLayout' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Object 'Timber' with '23' functions detected. Defined threshold inside objects is set to '11'
File 'TimberKt.kt' with '31' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'
Object 'StorageUtils' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside objects is set to '11'

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function init is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function initXMLAttrs is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function onTouchEvent is nested too deeply.
Function onDraw is nested too deeply.
Function getFileName is nested too deeply.
Function trim is nested too deeply.
Function convertBitmapToLEDHex is nested too deeply.

smells.name: ComplexCondition
smells.description: Complex conditions should be simplified and extracted into well-named methods if necessary.

instances.message: This condition is too complex.

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (position + 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: position + 1
Parentheses in (drawableInfo.image) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: drawableInfo.image
Parentheses in (offset * 3) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offset * 3
Parentheses in ((right - offset).toFloat() - (left + offset).toFloat()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: (right - offset).toFloat() - (left + offset).toFloat()
Parentheses in (singleCell * badgeWidth) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: singleCell * badgeWidth
Parentheses in (offsetXToAdd * 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offsetXToAdd * 2
Parentheses in (offsetXToAdd * 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offsetXToAdd * 2
Parentheses in (offsetXToAdd * 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offsetXToAdd * 2
Parentheses in (offsetXToAdd * 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offsetXToAdd * 2
Parentheses in (offsetXToAdd) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offsetXToAdd
Parentheses in (offsetXToAdd) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offsetXToAdd
Parentheses in (singleCell * badgeWidth) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: singleCell * badgeWidth
Parentheses in (offsetXToAdd * 3) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offsetXToAdd * 3
Parentheses in (singleCell * badgeHeight) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: singleCell * badgeHeight
Parentheses in (offsetXToAdd * 3) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offsetXToAdd * 3
Parentheses in (aIMarquee % 4) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: aIMarquee % 4
Parentheses in (aIMarquee % 4) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: aIMarquee % 4
Parentheses in (3 - (aIMarquee % 4)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 3 - (aIMarquee % 4)
Parentheses in (countFrame / (badgeWidth / 2)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: countFrame / (badgeWidth / 2)
Parentheses in (countFrame / (badgeWidth / 2)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: countFrame / (badgeWidth / 2)
Parentheses in (4 * (countFrame / (badgeWidth / 2))) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 4 * (countFrame / (badgeWidth / 2))
Parentheses in (checkList[0].list.size / badgeWidth) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: checkList[0].list.size / badgeWidth
Parentheses in ((checkList[0].list.size / badgeWidth) * (badgeWidth / 2)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: (checkList[0].list.size / badgeWidth) * (badgeWidth / 2)
Parentheses in (badgeHeight - 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeHeight - 1
Parentheses in (badgeHeight - 1 - virtualLine) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeHeight - 1 - virtualLine
Parentheses in (badgeHeight * 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeHeight * 2
Parentheses in (2 * badgeHeight - 1 - virtualLine) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 2 * badgeHeight - 1 - virtualLine
Parentheses in (badgeHeight * 3) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeHeight * 3
Parentheses in (badgeHeight * 4) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeHeight * 4
Parentheses in (badgeHeight) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeHeight
Parentheses in (5 * (badgeHeight) - 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 5 * (badgeHeight) - 1
Parentheses in (badgeWidth / 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeWidth / 2
Parentheses in (3 * (badgeWidth / 2)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 3 * (badgeWidth / 2)
Parentheses in (badgeWidth / 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeWidth / 2
Parentheses in (firstLine + 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: firstLine + 1
Parentheses in (3 * (badgeWidth / 2)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 3 * (badgeWidth / 2)
Parentheses in (4 * (badgeWidth / 2)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 4 * (badgeWidth / 2)
Parentheses in (badgeWidth + 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeWidth + 1
Parentheses in (2 * badgeWidth) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 2 * badgeWidth
Parentheses in (badgeWidth + 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeWidth + 1
Parentheses in (2 * badgeWidth) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 2 * badgeWidth
Parentheses in (badgeWidth) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badgeWidth
Parentheses in (3 * (badgeWidth)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 3 * (badgeWidth)
Parentheses in (0 until badgeWidth / 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 0 until badgeWidth / 2
Parentheses in (oneByte * allHex.size) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: oneByte * allHex.size
Parentheses in (offset * 3) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: offset * 3
Parentheses in ((right - offset).toFloat() - (left + offset).toFloat()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: (right - offset).toFloat() - (left + offset).toFloat()
Parentheses in (singleCell * badgeWidth) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: singleCell * badgeWidth

Parentheses in (File(EXTERNAL_STORAGE_DIRECTORY, getFileName(context, uri ?: Uri.EMPTY)).exists()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: File(EXTERNAL_STORAGE_DIRECTORY, getFileName(context, uri ?: Uri.EMPTY)).exists()
Parentheses in (drawableIcon) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: drawableIcon
Parentheses in (width - 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: width - 1
Parentheses in (height) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: height
Parentheses in (badge?.speed?.ordinal?.plus(1)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: badge?.speed?.ordinal?.plus(1)
Parentheses in (calendar[Calendar.MONTH] + 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: calendar[Calendar.MONTH] + 1

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
